Hello Soma,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #653972347555422208-87567, I am sorry to know that you have received medicines in a damaged condition. I have raised a return request for 2 quantities of the damaged GEMER P 2MG STRIP OF 10 TABLETS.

The medicines will be collected within 24 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear Mr. Himanshu,
Grievance Officer,
PharmEasy

I am writing to formally escalate my unresolved complaint regarding my
order which was incorrectly marked as delivered but never received.

Despite raising the issue through Level 1 support, my grievance has been
closed unfairly citing the 48-hour rule, even though no SMS or app
notification was ever received by me regarding delivery.

Complaint Details:

Order ID: #652243602087456768-40882
Ticket Number: #22242685
Order Date: 25th November 2025
Reported Delivered On: 28th November 2025

The facts are as follows:

The medicines were never delivered to my address

I received no SMS / app delivery notification

No OTP, no phone call, no delivery confirmation

No person at our home accepted the parcel

I was denied investigation purely due to time window, without any delivery
proof


The order included medicines for my elderly grandmother, who depends on
them for diabetes and BP. Denial of resolution without proof is extremely
distressing and unacceptable.

I respectfully request the following:

1. Reopening of Ticket #22242685


2. Investigation with:

Proof of delivery (photo/signature)

GPS / delivery coordinates

Delivery executive identity

Timestamp of any notification allegedly sent



3. Immediate replacement delivery or refund if no valid proof exists



Denying investigation without verifying customer-side notification failure
is against fair consumer practice.

If this matter is still not handled properly, I will be compelled to
escalate this to:

National Consumer Helpline (NCH)

Consumer Court (Online Filing)

Regulatory grievance portals


I sincerely hope to receive a just and prompt resolution.

Regards,
Arun Pradeep
Registered Mobile: 9895972518
Delivery Address: Srrenilayam, Krishnakripa Kalethuvalav, Peruva, Kerala, ,
Piravom, 686665
+91-8943461218

I understand your concern regarding the order #654701572389339136-30805.As per the records, your order was cancelled today. I apologise for any inconvenience caused to you with your order.

I see the refund of Rs. 3982.43 has been initiated today. It will be credited to your original payment source within 5 to 7 working days. You can track your refund via ARN number: 533632037165.

notes.body: Hello Jaswant,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.   Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '8875692205' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.   Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.   I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Jaswant,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to the promotional notifications, we always try to keep our customers updated on our offers. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused due to our promotional messages.

Please be assured, I have forwarded your request to unsubscribe your number '8875692205' from getting the promotional notifications. It will take 3 working days to process it completely. You will only receive your order-related information.

Further, if you wish to unsubscribe from getting the promotional notifications on your email id too, I request you to open your latest promotional email and hit unsubscribe at the bottom right-hand side corner to stop email promotions.

I certainly hope this helps and appreciate your understanding and patience in the meanwhile.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

Regards,
Manisha

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear PharmEasy Lab Support Team,

I am writing to express my serious dissatisfaction regarding Order ID:
6204304 for the blood test of Mr. Ram Niwas Yadav, my 71-year-old father.
The handling of this order has been completely unacceptable and reflects an
alarming level of negligence on your part.

On 27th November 2025, your assigned phlebotomist Mr. Mohd. Sarfaraz was
scheduled to collect the sample between 9:30 AM and 10:30 AM. He did not
call, did not arrive, and showed zero accountability. Despite multiple
attempts by several Thyrocare representativeswhile I remained constantly
on callhe refused to answer any phone call.

Because of this unacceptable failure, the slot was pushed to 28th November,
and your team assured me that strict action would be taken against the
phlebotomist and that a refund request report had been initiated.

What makes this situation far more serious is that my father, a 71-year-old
senior citizen, had been fasting for 12 hours from 26th to 27th November,
and due to your phlebotomists negligence, he was forced to fast again for
another 12 hours from 27th to 28th November.Repeated fasting at his age is
unsafe, medically irresponsible, and absolutely unjustifiable. This entire
ordeal was caused solely due to your teams failure to deliver basic
service.

To make matters worse, your team clearly confirmed that once the order is
processed and the reports are delivered, the refund would be credited
immediately.Yet nothing has happened. There is no refund, no update, and no
accountability from your side.

This is a blatant violation of PharmEasys own service policy, which states
that if sample collection is delayed, the entire order must be made free of
cost. You have failed both in service and in honouring your own commitments.

I am demanding an immediate full refund, without any further delay or
excuses.

I expect a written confirmation of refund initiation at once. Any further
delay will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter officially.
Regards,
Himanshu Yadav
Mob No. 9310523966

--

I am writing to express my serious dissatisfaction regarding Order ID: 6204304 for the blood test of Mr. Ram Niwas Yadav, my 71-year-old father. The handling of this order has been completely unacceptable and reflects an alarming level of negligence on your part.
On 27th November 2025, your assigned phlebotomist Mr. Mohd. Sarfaraz was scheduled to collect the sample between 9:30 AM and 10:30 AM. He did not call, did not arrive, and showed zero accountability. Despite multiple attempts by several Thyrocare representativeswhile I remained constantly on callhe refused to answer any phone call.
Because of this unacceptable failure, the slot was pushed to 28th November, and your team assured me that strict action would be taken against the phlebotomist and that a refund request report had been initiated.
What makes this situation far more serious is that my father, a 71-year-old senior citizen, had been fasting for 12 hours from 26th to 27th November, and due to your phlebotomists negligence, he was forced to fast again for another 12 hours from 27th to 28th November.Repeated fasting at his age is unsafe, medically irresponsible, and absolutely unjustifiable. This entire ordeal was caused solely due to your teams failure to deliver basic service.
To make matters worse, your team clearly confirmed that once the order is processed and the reports are delivered, the refund would be credited immediately.Yet nothing has happened. There is no refund, no update, and no accountability from your side.
This is a blatant violation of PharmEasys own service policy, which states that if sample collection is delayed, the entire order must be made free of cost. You have failed both in service and in honouring your own commitments.
I am demanding an immediate full refund, without any further delay or excuses.
I expect a written confirmation of refund initiation at once. Any further delay will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter officially.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: HIMANSHU YADAV <himanshu15oct@gmail.com>
Date: Tue, Dec 2, 2025 at 10:41AM
Subject: Immediate Action Required Full Refund for Order ID 6204304 Due to Severe Service Failure
To: <care@pharmeasy.in>, Grievance Officer <grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in>, <grievance-officer@docon.in>


Dear PharmEasy Lab Support Team,
I am writing to express my serious dissatisfaction regarding Order ID: 6204304 for the blood test of Mr. Ram Niwas Yadav, my 71-year-old father. The handling of this order has been completely unacceptable and reflects an alarming level of negligence on your part.
On 27th November 2025, your assigned phlebotomist Mr. Mohd. Sarfaraz was scheduled to collect the sample between 9:30 AM and 10:30 AM. He did not call, did not arrive, and showed zero accountability. Despite multiple attempts by several Thyrocare representativeswhile I remained constantly on callhe refused to answer any phone call.
Because of this unacceptable failure, the slot was pushed to 28th November, and your team assured me that strict action would be taken against the phlebotomist and that a refund request report had been initiated.
What makes this situation far more serious is that my father, a 71-year-old senior citizen, had been fasting for 12 hours from 26th to 27th November, and due to your phlebotomists negligence, he was forced to fast again for another 12 hours from 27th to 28th November.Repeated fasting at his age is unsafe, medically irresponsible, and absolutely unjustifiable. This entire ordeal was caused solely due to your teams failure to deliver basic service.
To make matters worse, your team clearly confirmed that once the order is processed and the reports are delivered, the refund would be credited immediately.Yet nothing has happened. There is no refund, no update, and no accountability from your side.
This is a blatant violation of PharmEasys own service policy, which states that if sample collection is delayed, the entire order must be made free of cost. You have failed both in service and in honouring your own commitments.
I am demanding an immediate full refund, without any further delay or excuses.
I expect a written confirmation of refund initiation at once. Any further delay will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter officially.
Regards,
Himanshu Yadav
Mob No. 9310523966

helpdesk_ticket.subject: Immediate Action Required  Full Refund for Order ID 6204304 Due to Severe Service Failure
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear PharmEasy Lab Support Team,
I am writing to express my serious dissatisfaction regarding Order ID: 6204304 for the blood test of Mr. Ram Niwas Yadav, my 71-year-old father. The handling of this order has been completely unacceptable and reflects an alarming level of negligence on your part.
On 27th November 2025, your assigned phlebotomist Mr. Mohd. Sarfaraz was scheduled to collect the sample between 9:30 AM and 10:30 AM. He did not call, did not arrive, and showed zero accountability. Despite multiple attempts by several Thyrocare representativeswhile I remained constantly on callhe refused to answer any phone call.
Because of this unacceptable failure, the slot was pushed to 28th November, and your team assured me that strict action would be taken against the phlebotomist and that a refund request report had been initiated.
What makes this situation far more serious is that my father, a 71-year-old senior citizen, had been fasting for 12 hours from 26th to 27th November, and due to your phlebotomists negligence, he was forced to fast again for another 12 hours from 27th to 28th November.Repeated fasting at his age is unsafe, medically irresponsible, and absolutely unjustifiable. This entire ordeal was caused solely due to your teams failure to deliver basic service.
To make matters worse, your team clearly confirmed that once the order is processed and the reports are delivered, the refund would be credited immediately.Yet nothing has happened. There is no refund, no update, and no accountability from your side.
This is a blatant violation of PharmEasys own service policy, which states that if sample collection is delayed, the entire order must be made free of cost. You have failed both in service and in honouring your own commitments.
I am demanding an immediate full refund, without any further delay or excuses.
I expect a written confirmation of refund initiation at once. Any further delay will leave me with no option but to escalate this matter officially.
Regards,
Himanshu Yadav
Mob No. 9310523966
